title: Related Party Disclosures (Ind AS 24) Disclosure Checklist

sections.title: Related Party Disclosures
sections.description: Checklist for presentation and disclosure requirements under Ind AS 24.

items.question: Has the entity disclosed the **relationship between parent and its subsidiaries**, irrespective of whether there have been transactions between them, and the **name of the parent and, if different, the ultimate controlling party** (or the next most senior parent if applicable)?

Has the entity disclosed **relationships, name of the related party, and nature of the related party relationship, when control exists**, irrespective of whether there have been transactions between the related parties?

Has the entity disclosed the **key management personnel compensation in total** for each of the following categories: Short-term employee benefits, Post-employment benefits, Other long-term benefits, Termination benefits, and Share-based payment?

If the entity had related party transactions, has it disclosed **information about the transactions and outstanding balances**, including commitments, necessary for an understanding of the potential effect of the relationship on the financial statements, including: **Nature of related party relationship, Amount of transactions, Amount of outstanding balances** (including terms and conditions, security, nature of consideration, and details of guarantees), **Provisions for doubtful debts related to outstanding balances**, and **Expense recognised in respect of bad or doubtful debts** due from related parties, and **amounts incurred for provision of key management personnel services** provided by a separate entity?

Have the disclosures required under paragraph 24.18 been **separately made for all categories of related parties**, including: The parent, Entities with joint control or significant influence over the entity, Subsidiaries, Associates, Joint ventures in which the entity is a joint venturer, Key management personnel of the entity or its parent, and Other related parties?
If there is a participation by a parent or subsidiary in a defined benefit plan that shares risks between group entities, has this been disclosed as a **related party transaction**?
Has the entity disclosed that related party transactions were made on **terms equivalent to those that prevail in an arm’s length transactions** provided that such terms can be substantiated?

Have items of similar nature been disclosed in aggregate, **except when separate disclosure is necessary for an understanding of the effects of related party transactions** on the financial statements of the entity, ensuring significant transactions are not obscured (e.g., purchases/sales of goods aggregated with fixed assets, or material individual transactions clubbed)?

If the exemption available in paragraph 24.25 (for government-related entities) is availed, has the entity disclosed: **The name of the government and the nature of its relationship** with the reporting entity, the **nature and amount of each individually significant transaction**, and for other collectively but not individually significant transactions, a **qualitative or quantitative indication of their extent**?
